ralgorithm

Class Slide

  • java.lang.Object
    • ralgorithm.Slide
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Movement

    public class Slide
extends java.lang.Object
implements Movement
    The Slide is a movement sliding one module along two adjacent modules.

    This slide movement is defined so that two modules can be sliding on top of eachother in parallel. (This is done by only using the half of the module to do expansion and contraction for the slide)

    Visual Aid: Modules are labeled with either a letter or number. Where A is the module of interest, and other modules are not part of the move, but important for handling connectedness and carrying.

    START
    4
    0A3
    12

    END
      4
    0A3
    12

    Requirements:

    • 1 exists iff 1 is connected to A and not connected to C
    • if 2 exists and is connected to A, then it can slide with A
    • if 0 exists and is connected to A, then it can slide with A
    Since:
    2/14/2016

    • Constructor Detail

      • Slide

        public Slide(Robot r,
             Module m,
             int dir,
             int neighborDir)
        Constructs a new slide movement given a module, a direction to slide, and the direction of modules to slide on.
        Parameters:
        r - Robot to perform the slide on
        m - Module to slide
        dir - Direction to slide m
        neighborDir - Direction of neighbors to slide m on, i.e. direction of B relative to A.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - given null module

    • Method Detail

      • initFromCoord

      • step

        public void step()
        Performs slide operations in 10 steps.

        Assumptions made:

        1. all modules are in a contracted state between move phases
        2. module size is 2
        3. dir and neighbor are adjacent directions
        4. B, C must have an edge between them

          5. Slides can be made in parallel on the same module

          Visual Aid: Units are labeled with either a letter or number. Where A is the module of interest, and other modules are not part of the move, but important for handling connectedness and carrying.

          START
          A2 A3
          A1 A0
          12 13 22 23

          END
                   A2 A3
                   A1 A0
          12 13 22 23

        Specified by:
        step in interface Movement

      • performHalfSlide

        public void performHalfSlide(Unit u1,
                             Unit u2,
                             Unit u3,
                             int step)
        performs half a contracted slide. Note this redefines Aloupis' contracted slide by only moving the bottom layer of the sliding moduel

        Visual Aid: Units are labeled with either a letter or number. Where A is the module of interest, and other modules are not part of the move, but important for handling connectedness and carrying.

        START
        A2 A3
        A1 A0
        u1 u2 u3

        END
             A2 A3
             A1 A0
        u1 u2 u3
